summary: I'm at the Whitestone arc in the first campaign and I started working on a drawing of Percy but it might be a while before I get...
body:
I’m at the Whitestone arc in the first campaign and I started working on a drawing of Percy but it might be a while before I get the time to color it.

I still wanted to post it, though.

icon description: fanart of scanlan from my critical role firefly au. he is a pale gnome with brown hair. he is posing like a model, with one hand behind his head and the other at his waist. his vest is rich purple with gold accents. he is wearing shear purple gloves and golden bicep jewelry. his makeup is purple-tinted. the background is pink. end id.

header description: a screenshot of an instagram message, a white bubble with black text, that reads, "Fuck you vax you made me chuckle". end id.

which if youll remember he does in all modern aus

summary: theory: beau is a ‘the good place’ character. evidence: shaped by her initial bad surroundings into having a negative impact on...
question: theory: beau is a ‘the good place’ character. evidence: shaped by her initial bad surroundings into having a negative impact on people (both others and herself), but once given the opportunity (ie. the support & love of the rest of the M9) is able to put in the effort to change in order to have a positive impact on both others and herself.
answer: And Beau says “fuck” as much as Eleanor would if it weren’t for network censorship lmao.

reblog.comment: And Beau says “fuck” as much as Eleanor would if it weren’t for network censorship lmao.

summary: hi i wanted to start watching critical role

should i start with the second season (then i can be up to date relatively soon and watch the first season afterwards) or the first season? are both seasons equally good?? im afraid of spoilers so i dont wanna look anything up help me pwease

summary: Do you think the Mighty Nien will kill Fjord if he starts going full evil? Cause I’m starting to feel like that’s where his...
question: Do you think the Mighty Nien will kill Fjord if he starts going full evil? Cause I’m starting to feel like that’s where his character is going right now (unless he has a very sudden attitude change) and part of me likes the idea because of the angst factor with the party having to kill one of their own but at the same time I really want him to have a redemption arc after this where there’s a bit of a reversal of him and Beau’s roles from earlier in the campaign.
answer: I don’t think Fjord is gonna go evil but I do think the group needs to be more vocal about their distaste for the way things are going and his attitude. If he was to start to turn, I think the group would work their hardest to subdue him and talk some sense into him rather than end him. I don’t even wanna think about that.

reblog.comment: I don’t think Fjord is gonna go evil but I do think the group needs to be more vocal about their distaste for the way things are going and his attitude. If he was to start to turn, I think the group would work their hardest to subdue him and talk some sense into him rather than end him. I don’t even wanna think about that.

trail.content_raw: I don’t think Fjord is gonna go evil but I do think the group needs to be more vocal about their distaste for the way things are going and his attitude. If he was to start to turn, I think the group would work their hardest to subdue him and talk some sense into him rather than end him. I don’t even wanna think about that.
trail.content: I don’t think Fjord is gonna go evil but I do think the group needs to be more vocal about their distaste for the way things are going and his attitude. If he was to start to turn, I think the group would work their hardest to subdue him and talk some sense into him rather than end him. I don’t even wanna think about that.

blog.name: princessamericachavez
blog.title: Your Ticket to the Multiverse
blog.description: Mexican 24. Journalist, writer, geek. Currently majoring in creative writing. She/Her.

tags: sorry i ended up using this ask to meta
summary: Laura is a genius, to me Jester has always been flirting and messing around with Fjord from the start with this idea of Oskar...
question: Laura is a genius, to me Jester has always been flirting and messing around with Fjord from the start with this idea of Oskar coming and saving her but as time went by she realized that Fjord isn't that savour (Avantica, the pirate arc) but is something else. Now in the playlist there is no mention of Fjord by name leading me to believe that she is trying to hide him for herself. She knows what she wants but doesn't want it to be him since he isn't what she thought she wanted. Thoughts?
answer:
I’m sorry, but I have to disagree.

I think the version of Fjord that Jester knew and fell in love with is the real Fjord, and what he’s been going through is the mask he’s hiding behind in a time of great pressure and stress.

First of all? The Oskar thing was never that she liked Fjord because of an idealized romantic hero… she liked Oskar because he reminded her of Fjord, her actual real life crush.

Now, as to Fjord being “something else” during this arc… here’s the things we know about the version of Fjord that Jester knew:

—Fjord has never lied to Jester, as per Travis’s own admission, aside from that one time during the live show which he clarified he would not have done if they’d been alone. 

—From the start she knew that his voice was false. Not only that, but she knew that he’d adopted Vandran’s accent, a sign of how deeply he’s mourning and that explains his drive during this whole arc far more than power hunger (notice how she’s always the one that brings up the fact that he hasn’t found enough information about Vandran yet? She knows it’s important).

—She probably knew that he was an orphan too. You can see if you go rewatch the scene when he tells the Nein. She clearly knew already. 

Now, what we know about Fjord’s actions so far: 

—Travis has talked a lot about how Fjord is struggling under pressure. 

—Fjord’s talk with Caduceus in which he points out that he’s only trying to keep Avantika close to keep everyone else safe and that he hopes the others know that, to which Cad replies ‘he’d be surprised’ because Cad knows Jester has been upset about it. 

—Fjord constantly asking the M9 if they are ok with his choices and asking them to speak up if any of it makes them uncomfortable.

—Fjord acting widely different one-on-one with Avantika than he does with the M9.

—Travis said in Fjord’s playlist: 

The weight of Fjord’s responsibilities weigh on him constantly. New powers, new mission, new friends, new crew. The last time he felt this comfortable, everything was ripped away from him — violently. He feels like the waves may be breaking over his head, and struggling to catch his breath he must keep a calm demeanor and steady hand — and push on.

—And:

Fjord feels strange and exciting powers surging within him, and as much as he wants to push the envelope of what he’s capable of, he must rely on those he’s closest with to check him, to keep him grounded — or he might lose more than just his sense of self.

—So we can confirm that the Fjord we, the M9, and Jester, knew from the start was the real one, and that this road is taking him down a path that is new to him and that feels a little like losing himself. 

And what Jester’s playlist says is: 

When you think you know someone and you really like them but then they start behaving differently than you’ve ever seen and you don’t know if it’s the real them finally peeking out or if it’s just a mask they’re trying on for a little bit and you feel really confused about it. Also, they sort of kissed you

—Without the meta knowledge and other conversations, it makes sense that Jester would start to second-guess.

—Her worry, though, is not knowing which side of Fjord is real. 

—And and and- according to the song choice “You’re Someone Else”, she also fears that he is losing himself, that this person is so far removed from the one she loves. 

Well you look like yourself
But you’re somebody else
Only it ain’t on the surface
Well you talk like yourself
No, I hear someone else though
Now you’re making me nervous

—Plus, the song talks about having known the real him from the start, and realizing that this version is different.

So where does that leave us: 

—Jester loves the version of Fjord she got to know from the start.

—That version is, most likely, the real Fjord. 

—Fjord has been putting on a mask as he deals with some very stressful times and his traumatic past and fears he’s losing himself.

—Jester sees this and is afraid that this version of him is maybe the real one (it’s not) and that he is losing himself (he might be on the road to it). 

BUT THERE’S A SILVER LINING.

—Think of Fjord’s song of choice for Jester. Sunflower brings us: 

Every time I’m leavin’ on ya
You don’t make it easy, no, no
Wish I could be there for ya
Give me a reason to go
Every time I’m walkin’ out
I can hear you tellin’ me to turn around
Fightin’ for my trust and you won’t back down
Even if we gotta risk it all right now, oh

—Jester might just be the one person able to bring Fjord back from the darkness he’s drowning in, remind him who he really is or, at the very least, make him realize he could very well lose everything he’s trying to protect if he isn’t careful. 

—Fjord has work to do too, because if he doesn’t wake up soon and starts mending the bridges he’s burned, Jester might have to chase the sun elsewhere for her own emotional well-being.

One day, you’ll know
I was the one
But tomorrow may rain, so
I’ll follow the sun
And now the time has come
And so, my love, I must go
And though I lose a friend
In the end you will know

THERE’S ALWAYS HOPE, THOUGH, BECAUSE YOU KNOW SUNFLOWERS FOLLOW THE SUN, BUT JESTER WAS NEVER THE SUNFLOWER, SHE’S FJORD’S SUN AND WARMTH AND HAPPINESS, AND EXACTLY WHAT HE NEEDS RIGHT NOW. 

Thanks for coming to my ted talk.

—From the start she knew that his voice was false. Not only that, but she knew that he’d adopted Vandran’s accent, a sign of how deeply he’s mourning and that explains his drive during this whole arc far more than power hunger (notice how she’s always the one that brings up the fact that he hasn’t found enough information about Vandran yet? She knows it’s important).

—She probably knew that he was an orphan too. You can see if you go rewatch the scene when he tells the Nein. She clearly knew already. 

Now, what we know about Fjord’s actions so far: 

—Travis has talked a lot about how Fjord is struggling under pressure. 

—Fjord’s talk with Caduceus in which he points out that he’s only trying to keep Avantika close to keep everyone else safe and that he hopes the others know that, to which Cad replies ‘he’d be surprised’ because Cad knows Jester has been upset about it. 

—Fjord constantly asking the M9 if they are ok with his choices and asking them to speak up if any of it makes them uncomfortable.

—Fjord acting widely different one-on-one with Avantika than he does with the M9.

—Travis said in Fjord’s playlist: 

The weight of Fjord’s responsibilities weigh on him constantly. New powers, new mission, new friends, new crew. The last time he felt this comfortable, everything was ripped away from him — violently. He feels like the waves may be breaking over his head, and struggling to catch his breath he must keep a calm demeanor and steady hand — and push on.

—And:

Fjord feels strange and exciting powers surging within him, and as much as he wants to push the envelope of what he’s capable of, he must rely on those he’s closest with to check him, to keep him grounded — or he might lose more than just his sense of self.

—So we can confirm that the Fjord we, the M9, and Jester, knew from the start was the real one, and that this road is taking him down a path that is new to him and that feels a little like losing himself. 

And what Jester’s playlist says is: 

When you think you know someone and you really like them but then they start behaving differently than you’ve ever seen and you don’t know if it’s the real them finally peeking out or if it’s just a mask they’re trying on for a little bit and you feel really confused about it. Also, they sort of kissed you

—Without the meta knowledge and other conversations, it makes sense that Jester would start to second-guess.

—Her worry, though, is not knowing which side of Fjord is real. 

—And and and- according to the song choice “You’re Someone Else”, she also fears that he is losing himself, that this person is so far removed from the one she loves. 

Well you look like yourself
But you’re somebody else
Only it ain’t on the surface
Well you talk like yourself
No, I hear someone else though
Now you’re making me nervous

—Plus, the song talks about having known the real him from the start, and realizing that this version is different.

So where does that leave us: 

—Jester loves the version of Fjord she got to know from the start.

—That version is, most likely, the real Fjord. 

—Fjord has been putting on a mask as he deals with some very stressful times and his traumatic past and fears he’s losing himself.

—Jester sees this and is afraid that this version of him is maybe the real one (it’s not) and that he is losing himself (he might be on the road to it). 

BUT THERE’S A SILVER LINING.

—Think of Fjord’s song of choice for Jester. Sunflower brings us: 

Every time I’m leavin’ on ya
You don’t make it easy, no, no
Wish I could be there for ya
Give me a reason to go
Every time I’m walkin’ out
I can hear you tellin’ me to turn around
Fightin’ for my trust and you won’t back down
Even if we gotta risk it all right now, oh

—Jester might just be the one person able to bring Fjord back from the darkness he’s drowning in, remind him who he really is or, at the very least, make him realize he could very well lose everything he’s trying to protect if he isn’t careful. 

—Fjord has work to do too, because if he doesn’t wake up soon and starts mending the bridges he’s burned, Jester might have to chase the sun elsewhere for her own emotional well-being.

One day, you’ll know
I was the one
But tomorrow may rain, so
I’ll follow the sun
And now the time has come
And so, my love, I must go
And though I lose a friend
In the end you will know

THERE’S ALWAYS HOPE, THOUGH, BECAUSE YOU KNOW SUNFLOWERS FOLLOW THE SUN, BUT JESTER WAS NEVER THE SUNFLOWER, SHE’S FJORD’S SUN AND WARMTH AND HAPPINESS, AND EXACTLY WHAT HE NEEDS RIGHT NOW. 

Thanks for coming to my ted talk.
trail.content:
I’m sorry, but I have to disagree.

I think the version of Fjord that Jester knew and fell in love with is the real Fjord, and what he’s been going through is the mask he’s hiding behind in a time of great pressure and stress.

First of all? The Oskar thing was never that she liked Fjord because of an idealized romantic hero… she liked Oskar because he reminded her of Fjord, her actual real life crush.

Now, as to Fjord being “something else” during this arc… here’s the things we know about the version of Fjord that Jester knew:

—Fjord has never lied to Jester, as per Travis’s own admission, aside from that one time during the live show which he clarified he would not have done if they’d been alone. 

—From the start she knew that his voice was false. Not only that, but she knew that he’d adopted Vandran’s accent, a sign of how deeply he’s mourning and that explains his drive during this whole arc far more than power hunger (notice how she’s always the one that brings up the fact that he hasn’t found enough information about Vandran yet? She knows it’s important).

—She probably knew that he was an orphan too. You can see if you go rewatch the scene when he tells the Nein. She clearly knew already. 

Now, what we know about Fjord’s actions so far: 

—Travis has talked a lot about how Fjord is struggling under pressure. 

—Fjord’s talk with Caduceus in which he points out that he’s only trying to keep Avantika close to keep everyone else safe and that he hopes the others know that, to which Cad replies ‘he’d be surprised’ because Cad knows Jester has been upset about it. 

—Fjord constantly asking the M9 if they are ok with his choices and asking them to speak up if any of it makes them uncomfortable.

—Fjord acting widely different one-on-one with Avantika than he does with the M9.

—Travis said in Fjord’s playlist: 

The weight of Fjord’s responsibilities weigh on him constantly. New powers, new mission, new friends, new crew. The last time he felt this comfortable, everything was ripped away from him — violently. He feels like the waves may be breaking over his head, and struggling to catch his breath he must keep a calm demeanor and steady hand — and push on.

—And:

Fjord feels strange and exciting powers surging within him, and as much as he wants to push the envelope of what he’s capable of, he must rely on those he’s closest with to check him, to keep him grounded — or he might lose more than just his sense of self.

—So we can confirm that the Fjord we, the M9, and Jester, knew from the start was the real one, and that this road is taking him down a path that is new to him and that feels a little like losing himself. 

And what Jester’s playlist says is: 

When you think you know someone and you really like them but then they start behaving differently than you’ve ever seen and you don’t know if it’s the real them finally peeking out or if it’s just a mask they’re trying on for a little bit and you feel really confused about it. Also, they sort of kissed you

—Without the meta knowledge and other conversations, it makes sense that Jester would start to second-guess.

—Her worry, though, is not knowing which side of Fjord is real. 

—And and and- according to the song choice “You’re Someone Else”, she also fears that he is losing himself, that this person is so far removed from the one she loves. 

Well you look like yourself
But you’re somebody else
Only it ain’t on the surface
Well you talk like yourself
No, I hear someone else though
Now you’re making me nervous

—Plus, the song talks about having known the real him from the start, and realizing that this version is different.

So where does that leave us: 

—Jester loves the version of Fjord she got to know from the start.

—That version is, most likely, the real Fjord. 

—Fjord has been putting on a mask as he deals with some very stressful times and his traumatic past and fears he’s losing himself.

—Jester sees this and is afraid that this version of him is maybe the real one (it’s not) and that he is losing himself (he might be on the road to it). 

BUT THERE’S A SILVER LINING.

—Think of Fjord’s song of choice for Jester. Sunflower brings us: 

Every time I’m leavin’ on ya
You don’t make it easy, no, no
Wish I could be there for ya
Give me a reason to go
Every time I’m walkin’ out
I can hear you tellin’ me to turn around
Fightin’ for my trust and you won’t back down
Even if we gotta risk it all right now, oh

—Jester might just be the one person able to bring Fjord back from the darkness he’s drowning in, remind him who he really is or, at the very least, make him realize he could very well lose everything he’s trying to protect if he isn’t careful. 

—Fjord has work to do too, because if he doesn’t wake up soon and starts mending the bridges he’s burned, Jester might have to chase the sun elsewhere for her own emotional well-being.

One day, you’ll know
I was the one
But tomorrow may rain, so
I’ll follow the sun
And now the time has come
And so, my love, I must go
And though I lose a friend
In the end you will know

THERE’S ALWAYS HOPE, THOUGH, BECAUSE YOU KNOW SUNFLOWERS FOLLOW THE SUN, BUT JESTER WAS NEVER THE SUNFLOWER, SHE’S FJORD’S SUN AND WARMTH AND HAPPINESS, AND EXACTLY WHAT HE NEEDS RIGHT NOW. 

Thanks for coming to my ted talk.
